headline.main: Too Dandy for Tough Times — Or Is Couture the Cure?

docs.snippet: True to its corset-and-drama heritage, Alexander McQueen is teaming with the traditional Savile Row tailor Huntsman to create a made-to-order suit service. With today's casual lifestyle and the sagging global economy, is the market there for high-...
docs.abstract: True to its corset-and-drama heritage, Alexander McQueen is teaming with the traditional Savile Row tailor Huntsman to create a made-to-order suit service. With today's casual lifestyle and the sagging global economy, is the market there for high-end tailoring? Or is fashion one way to beat back the bleakness?
docs.lead_paragraph: Alexander McQueen is dead but not gone. True to its corset-and-drama heritage, the brand is teaming with the traditional Savile Row tailor Huntsman to create a made-to-order suit service. The designer Sarah Burton announced the move in Milan during the men's wear autumn 2012 season, writes Suzy Menkes, the IHT fashion editor, where the tilt in men's fashion toward formal and evening wear is being confirmed every day.

headline.main: 'Magic/Bird' To Land at the Longacre Theater

docs.snippet: The play about the rivalry and friendship between Larry Bird and Magic Johnson has a Broadway theater and a complete cast....
docs.abstract: The play about the rivalry and friendship between Larry Bird and Magic Johnson has a Broadway theater and a complete cast.
docs.lead_paragraph: "Magic/Bird," Eric Simonson's play about the rivalry and friendship between Larry Bird, the former Boston Celtics forward, and Magic Johnson, the Los Angeles Lakers point guard, has a Broadway theater and a complete cast. The play, to be directed by Thomas Kail, will open on April 11 at the Longacre Theater, the show's producers announced Tuesday. Previews begin March 21.

docs.snippet: Despite the latest signs of continued economic turmoil in Europe, men's wear designers are not shying away from on luxury fabrics for fall....
docs.abstract: Despite the latest signs of continued economic turmoil in Europe, men's wear designers are not shying away from on luxury fabrics for fall.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite the latest signs of continued economic turmoil in Europe, men's wear designers are not shying away from on luxury fabrics for fall, what with all the press notes about vicuña and cashmere. One unexpected, and very expensive, material that turned up in several collections in Milan was astrakhan, a fairly controversial fur that is also known as Persian lamb, made from the skins of newborn (and sometimes unborn) lambs.
